revised_title: Iron Conversion: Puddling Process and Inflammable Air
tldr: The author, Thomas Beddoes, conducted experiments to further understand the process of converting cast iron into malleable iron, also known as puddling. He discovered that the process involves the extrication of inflammable air at different stages, which helps in determining the real degree of confidence in the theory of the process. The experiments also confirmed the real extrication of air, which varied in nature at various periods of the process.
